Comment.value:
first time pc finds a gem
destroy gems as soon as the conversation ends, so each can only be used once.

value.0: This gem glows slightly with an eerie light, as if it contained some kind of living energy. As you hold it up to examine it, you feel the faintest touch of another mind contacting your own.
"What is taking you so long... wait, this is not the mind of one of my minions. Who are you? What are you doing with this gem?"
"Then you shall die, as will the rest of the fools who hide behind their precious stone walls."
"Oh... Fascinating... As if I didn't have enough problems already."
"Very well... we shall play it your way then. Since you are obviously not one of my creatures, you must be one of the enemy."
"There is much I need to do before my armies are properly rebuilt. I have no time to waste on someone who shall be dead very soon, so if you will excuse me..."
The gem crumbles to powder in your hand, as whatever the creature was that spoke to your mind dismisses you.
"Not much smarter than my goblins, are you? Answer my question and I might answer yours."
As you touch the second gem you feel the same presence touch your mind. The touch is definitely one of communication, not powerful enough to read more than your surface thoughts.
"You again! I am quickly growing tired of your interference. You and the meddling fools in the keep shall soon be dead."
"There is nothing you need to know. You have shown a little skill, but nothing that I should fear. Were you truly intelligent, you would wield a weapon I do fear."
There is a brief pause during which you feel some intense emotions of hatred, fear and curiosity. "So, you prove you do have some, limited intelligence."
"But I sense that you have not yet gained control of the army. So, all I must do is finish my preparations and destroy you, before you can destroy me."
"I do not fear you!" The conversation ends abruptly, but you have the distinct notion that your opponent was definitely lying as the gem crumbles to dust.
<StartCheck>[Failed]</Start> "I know you do not. I doubt you even have any inkling of what I am trying. Do you not think I can see right through your bluff?"
"I merely enjoy toying with your pathetic little mind. But I think my amusement has ended. Goodbye."
The gem crumbles much like the previous, completely used up.
"As if I would tell you such a thing. I merely enjoy toying with your pathetic little mind. But I think my amusement has ended. Goodbye."
The gem crumbles much like the previous, completely used up.

LinkComment.value: if PC knows about undead army

value.0: "Funny, I feel the same way about you. You have shown a little skill, but nothing terribly impressive. Were you truly intelligent, you would wield a weapon I do fear."

LinkComment.value: if PC knows about undead army

value.0: "You think I am losing? How little you know. You have shown a little skill, but nothing terribly impressive. Were you truly intelligent, you would wield a weapon I do fear."
"The loss of my dark dwarves is a temporary setback, but I have plenty of allies left. You shall meet them soon, when my armies crush your little Keep of Cyan."

LinkComment.value: if PC knows about undead army

value.0: "But enough of this conversation. You have shown a little skill, but nothing terribly impressive. Were you truly intelligent, you would wield a weapon I do fear."
"The goblins were nothing more than fodder to throw against your pathetic defenders. They were more of a nuisance to feed than they were worth on the battlefield."
"So, the foolish kobolds have fallen, have they? Since I have already transported most of the food stuffs to my main caves, I am not worried about their loss."
As you touch this gem, the presence of your adversary leaps into your mind. You feel a bitterness and anger directed towards you that is almost overwhelming.
"Again?!? This has grown tiresome. I know all about you, <FullName>! Oh, what surprises I hold in store for you. A lifetime of horrors! I should have killed you when I had the chance."
"Despite your meddling, my army is nearly ready. Soon I shall be paying the Keep of Cyan a little visit."
Your opponent seems shaken by your confidence and you feel the faintest tremors of fear in its mind.

Comment.value: show a ghostly image in front of the PC of the illithid, use some of the new ghost effects

value.0: Suddenly your mind seems to flee from the confines of your body and your awareness enters the mind of your adversary.
It is an unpleasant experience, but you realize instantly that your adversary is an illithid. A mindflayer. The infamous Masked Man.
"What? What are you doing? How did you get in my mind? GET OUT OF MY MIND!" The illithid's scream tears into your consciousness and you are returned to your own body, the gem crumbling in your hand.
Warily you touch the gem. Once again your mind feels the touch of the illithid, the one who you once knew only as the Masked Man.

"You have done far more damage than I thought you capable of, but it doesn't matter now. I have collapsed the tunnels that lead to my army and they shall not be re-opened until I am ready to face you."
"Already, the Illithid Council is sending up armies of thralls to assist in my war. It is only a matter of time before you are destroyed. Prepare as you will. It soon will not matter in the least."
"This is the last time you will be communicating with me. My armies are swollen to the point that they can barely be contained within the huge caverns we occupy. Our march will begin soon."
"I am the future <Lord/Lady> of the Keep."
"I am <FullName>, hero of the keep."
"I am nobody of consequence."
"Who are you?"
"Since you are so confident, tell me about yourself."

Comment.value: if PC knows about undead army

value.0: "You don't mean the undead army, do you?"
<StartCheck>[Bluff]</Start> "I already have the weapon."
"And what is this weapon?"
"I don't fear you."
"That is the bravado I would expect from one who is losing."

value.0: "It will be hard for you to keep an army without food."
"Your allies have proven to be pathetically weak."
"I doubt you have much of an army left at all."
